org.stanwood.media.source
Class TagChimpSource

java.lang.Object
  org.stanwood.media.source.TagChimpSource
All Implemented Interfaces:
ISource
public class TagChimpSource
extends java.lang.Object
implements ISource

This class is a source used to retrieve information about films from "www.tagchimp.com". This source has the option parameter "regexpToReplace". This is used when searching for a film via the film's filename. The parameter is a regular expression, that when found in the filename, is removed. Use the method setRegexpToReplace to set the regular expression.

searchForVideoId

public SearchResult searchForVideoId(Mode mode,
                                     java.io.File filmFile)
                              throws SourceException,
                                     java.net.MalformedURLException,
                                     java.io.IOException
This will search the IMDB site for the film. It uses the last segment of the file name, converts it to lower case, tidies up the name and performs the search.

Specified by:
searchForVideoId in interface ISource
Parameters:
filmFile - The file the film is located in
mode - The mode that the search operation should be performed in
Returns:
Always returns null
Throws:
SourceException - Thrown if their is a problem retrieving the data
java.net.MalformedURLException - Thrown if their is a problem creating URL's
java.io.IOException - Thrown if their is a I/O related problem.
